name: AdGroup
desc: The response to ad group requests.

items.name: automatedKeywordsOptIn
items.desc: The parameter for enabling and disabling Search Match. If true, the system automatically adds optimized keywords in addition to those you explicitly add to the ad group.See the Enable and Disable Search Match section of Ad Groups.You can use the EQUALS selector Condition operator with Find Ad Groups.

items.name: campaignId
items.desc: The unique identifier for a campaign.You can use the EQUALS, IN, and STARTSWITH selector Condition operators with Find Ad Groups.

items.name: cpaGoal
items.desc: An optional limit for the cost-per-acquisition goal.NoteYou can’t set the cpaGoal parameter when the pricingModel has a value of CPM.

items.name: defaultBidAmount
items.desc: The default maximum cost per tap/impression bid for the ad group.

items.name: deleted
items.desc: The indicator of whether the ad group is soft-deleted. This includes keywords that belong to an ad group.You can use the EQUALS and IN selector Condition operators with Find Ad Groups.

items.name: displayStatus
items.desc: The status of the ad group. The status resolves according to servingStatus and additional criteria.

items.name: endTime
items.desc: The scheduled end date and time for the ad group, which the system determines from the ad group with the latest end time.

items.name: id
items.desc: The unique identifier for the ad group that you can use as adGroupId in endpoint resources.You can use the EQUALS, IN, and STARTSWITH selector Condition operators with Find Ad Groups.

items.name: modificationTime
items.desc: The date and time of the most recent modification of the object.

items.name: name
items.desc: The unique name of the ad group. Responses don’t include deleted ad groups.You can use the EQUALS, IN, and STARTSWITH selector Condition operators with Find Ad Groups.

items.name: orgId
items.desc: The identifier of the organization that owns the campaign. Your orgId is the same as your account in the Apple Search Ads UI.

items.name: paymentModel
items.desc: The payment model that you set through the Search Ads UI. If you don’t set a payment model, campaigns can’t run.See PaymentModel for value descriptions.If you don’t select a payment model, you can still create campaigns. You must select a payment model before a campaign is eligible to run.See BudgetOrder for details about setting a payment model.

items.name: pricingModel
items.desc: The type of bid that is set. See PricingModel for value descriptions.

items.name: servingStateReasons
items.desc: A list of reasons that displays when an ad group isn’t running.

items.name: servingStatus
items.desc: The status of whether the ad group is serving.

items.name: startTime
items.desc: The scheduled start date and time for the ad group with the earliest start time in the campaign.

items.name: status
items.desc: The user-controlled status to enable or pause the ad group.This field is updatable.You can use the EQUALS selector Condition operator with Find Ad Groups.

items.name: targetingDimensions
items.desc: The targeting criteria to narrow the audience. Targeting options include age, gender, geolocation, daypart, device, and app downloaders.
